result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J Ranta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

records.addlTxt: Call from Mr Ranta that he is attempting to reach the court reporter for transcripts from his original plea date and sentencing after revocation hearings for a federal sentencing he has coming up. Mr Ranta states he has made many calls to the COCC office and the court reporter to obtain these and has had no success.  Call transferred to the court reporter this day.

Notice of Parole Consideration

Defendant Steven J Ranta in court with attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal.  Defendant Steven J Ranta in custody.  Robert S. Lipak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No corrections to revocation packet by either party.  Argument will be entered by both sides.  State believes that DE is entitled to 152 days credit, State asking for a prison term.  Atty Rosenthal believes count was over charged, asking for 90 days jail. The court will order 12 month jail, 152 days credit, concurrent to any other sentence DE currently serving.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 26, 2018 at 04:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 19, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DE has indicated he does not intend to seek PCR.
Case settlement

Defendant Steven J Ranta in court with attorney James H Krave.  Defendant Steven J Ranta in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights. DE will enter a plea of NC, court will accept and find the DE guilty.   Ct 1 will be amended to substancial battery, Ct 2 will be DRI.  Sentence will be withheld, 2 years probation, CC. DNA sample/surcharge, no firearm possession, no body armour, sentence will be concurrent to sentence currently serving.
Transport  (four to the state)

Review hearing on August 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Review hearing on May 31, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Steven J Ranta in court with attorney Annette M Barna both appearing telephonic.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waive reading of the information, enter plea of NG.  Set for RH 5/31/16 @ 2:00PM.
Arraignment on April 4, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Annette M Barna in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE does not appear, wishes to be contacted telephonic.  Court contacts DE telephonic. DE will waive PH hearing, Court instructs on waiver of PH.  Court will accept waiver.    Information filed this day in court by the State.  Set for arraignment 4-04-16 @ 1:00PM.
Preliminary hearing at 03-01-2016 03:30 pm

Defendant Steven J Ranta in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  Defendant Steven J Ranta in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty states DE was not aware of charges, had not been served.  Atty asking for release on sign bond.  DE has cases pending in other counties.  The court will reduce bond to $500.00 cash.  Quash warrant.  DE/Atty will waive time limits for PH.  Court instructs on waiver of TL, court will accept waiver.  Set for PH 3-01-16 @ 3:30PM.
Return on warrant at 01-26-2016 11:00 am

In lieu of holding DE in custody, bond may be posted in the amount of $1000.00.
The State will extradite, Enter Nationwide.
Filed by the District Attorney's office.

Defendant Steven J Ranta not in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an AOM with the court.  Court will authorize a probable cause warrant $1000.00 cash, will extradite. DA to prepare.
